alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 26 at 3:12PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Chesterfield County through 345 PM EDT... At 312 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Carolina Sandhills Wildlife Refuge, or 18 miles northwest of Hartsville, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cheraw, Chesterfield, Carolina Sandhills Wildlife Refuge, Cheraw State Park, Cheraw Municipal Airport, Northeastern Technical College, Patrick, Cheraw Fish Hatchery, Bay Springs Fire Station and Chesterfield Detention Center. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
